list.title: NedbBaseDocument#getData
list.description: Get the plain JavaScript object representation of a SuperCamo document instance.

list.title: NedbBaseDocument.create
list.description: Create a new instance of the model.

list.title: NedbClient
list.description: Creates an instance of NedbClient.

list.title: NedbClient#collectionExistsInInstance
list.description: Determine whether or not a specific collection name exists in the used database client instance.

list.title: NedbClient#count
list.description: Query a collection and receive a number representing the count of documents matching that query.

list.title: NedbClient#createIndex
list.description:
Create an index on a specified collection's field(s), as per the NeDB documentation:

https://github.com/seald/nedb?tab=readme-ov-file#indexing

list.title: NedbClient#driver
list.description:
Gets the raw collections list from the database client instance.

Try not to use this - use the methods on the instance to do things to/with collections instead.

list.title: NedbClient#dropDatabase
list.description: Remove all documents from all collections.

list.title: NedbClient#dumpDatabase
list.description: Retrieves all documents from all collections, turns them all into objects, and puts them all into an array.

list.title: NedbClient#dumpDatabaseDocuments
list.description: Retrieves all documents from all collections, turns them all into objects, and puts them all into an array.

list.title: NedbClient#findAndDeleteMany
list.description: Find and delete multiple documents from a specified collection.

list.title: NedbClient#findAndDeleteOne
list.description: Find and delete one document from a specified collection.

list.title: NedbClient#findAndUpdateMany
list.description:
Find and update or or more matching documents within a specified collection, as per the NeDB documentation.

https://github.com/seald/nedb?tab=readme-ov-file#updating-documents

list.title: NedbClient#findAndUpdateOne
list.description:
Find and update one matching document within a specified collection, as per the NeDB documentation.

https://github.com/seald/nedb?tab=readme-ov-file#updating-documents

Note that if multiple documents would match the given query, only the first matched document will be updated.

list.title: NedbClient#findManyDocuments
list.description:
Query a collection and receive one or more documents matching that query.

This method is NOT compatible with NeDB projections, and thus returns an array of instances of the document used by the specified collection.

list.title: NedbClient#findManyObjects
list.description:
Query a collection and receive one or more objects matching that query.

This method is compatible with NeDB projections, and thus returns an array of plain object.

list.title: NedbClient#findOneDocument
list.description:
Query a collection and receive the first document matching that query.

This method is NOT compatible with NeDB projections, and thus returns an instance of the document used by the specified collection.

list.title: NedbClient#findOneObject
list.description:
Query a collection and receive the first document (as an object) matching that query.

This method is compatible with NeDB projections, and thus returns a plain object.

list.title: NedbClient#getCollectionAccessor
list.description: Retrieve the collection meta object stored on the NeDB client instance matching a given collection name.

list.title: NedbClient#getModelsList
list.description: Retrieve a distinct list of models used in the collections of this NedbClient.

list.title: NedbClient#insertMany
list.description:
Create multiple new documents within a specified collection, as per the NeDB documentation.

https://github.com/seald/nedb?tab=readme-ov-file#inserting-documents

list.title: NedbClient#insertOne
list.description:
Create a singular new document within a specified collection, as per the NeDB documentation.

https://github.com/seald/nedb?tab=readme-ov-file#inserting-documents

list.title: NedbClient#removeDatabase
list.description: Remove all database data from the filesystem. This means that all documents within this NeDB client instance's collections are removed, all collection objects on the NeDB client instance are removed, and all .db files relevant to this NeDB client instance are removed from the file system.

list.title: NedbClient#removeIndex
list.description:
Remove an index on a specified collection's field(s), as per the NeDB documentation:

https://github.com/seald/nedb?tab=readme-ov-file#indexing

list.title: SuperCamo#connect
list.description:
Connect to a new database client instance, store its reference in SuperCamo's SuperCamo.activeClients property, and return the newly-connected instance.

This also creates the database if it didn't already exist.

list.title: SuperCamo#getClientByName
list.description: Retrieve a specific active database client instance from SuperCamo.

list.title: SuperCamo#getClientList
list.description: Retrieve the list of database names registered to SuperCamo within this app's current lifetime.

list.title: SuperCamo#getRegisteredModels
list.description: Return an array of all NedbDocuments and NedbEmbeddedDocuments registered in this app's current session usage of SuperCamo. Should be a unique list, no duplicate models.

list.title: SuperCamo.activeClients
list.description: An object containing each connected database client. Access a specific database client using its name.

list.title: SuperCamoLogger
list.description:
Configured logging system for the SuperCamo package.

Pass a string to this, and it'll automatically figure out which NodeJS util.DebugLogger to use.

This is not something for users of the SuperCamo package to directly use. Instead, this is something impacted by usage of the NODE_DEBUG environment variable.

For example, if you want logging from multiple packages, including SuperCamo, you may want to set NODE_DEBUG to be or include "verbose". This would enable multiple packages to log. But if you only want SuperCamo to log, and not any other packages, you may want to set NODE_DEBUG to be or include "supercamo".
